day.JPG?rnd=0.568623661328397","caption":"The SAGA Club celebrates PS I Love You Day, Feb. 14, to bring awareness to the importance of mental health and anti-bullying. Purple is worn as symbol of unity and to show that they are here to help students with anything that is bothering them. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"IMG_5151","src":"IMG_5151.JPG?rnd=0.314762059280072","caption":"Congratulations to Advanced Placement Art students Julia Cutajar, Ruth Castillo and Matthew Tepper for earning honors at the 2020 Scholastic Art & Writing Awards competition. Julia won a Silver Award and an Honorable Mention for her photography, Ruth earned a Silver Award for her acrylic painting, and Matt received a Gold Award for his photography. His piece will advance to a national jury where more than 2,700 top artists and writers will earn National Medals. National Medalists are celebrated at a ceremony at Carnegie Hall in June. Matt also received Honorable Mention for his art portfolio. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"IMG_3737","src":"IMG_3737.JPG?rnd=0.0337053276755406","caption":"OBHS Mathletes brought three teams to compete at the Nassau County Mathematic Tournament at SUNY Old Westbury. Coach Ms. Amy Michalopoulos called it a great day of competition on grade level and as a team.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"7F84E25C-BC28-49D4-9531-B3218C22E274","src":"7F84E25C-BC28-49D4-9531-B3218C22E274.jpeg?rnd=0.190997069790492","caption":"Congratulations Girls All County 4x400 relay team! They broke the school record at the Yale Cup earlier in the season!","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Kowalsky Nassau County Champ 2020-02-06 102431","src":"Kowalsky Nassau County Champ 2020-02-06 102431.jpg?rnd=0.623034938528684","caption":"Congratulations to Rachel Kowalsky, Nassau County Epee Champion for Women's Fencing.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Underclassmen Fencing Medalists","src":"Underclassmen Fencing Medalists.jpg?rnd=0.700492091803109","caption":"Congratulations to our Nassau County Underclassmen Fencing Tournament medalists: freshman Dylan Sattar, 3rd place Men's Foil; junior Peter Amendolara, 3rd place, Men's Epee; and freshman Ella Cortes, 3rd place, Women's Saber. Students competed against 120 participants throughout the county.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"IMG_5153 - Copy","src":"IMG_5153 - Copy.JPG?rnd=0.475428424531328","caption":"Congratulations to OBHS teachers Dr. Meagan Dissinger and Ms. Andrea Breun for becoming National Board Certified Teachers. img.alt: OBEN Welcomes New K-12 Math Supervisor

a.span: OBEN Welcomes New K-12 Math Supervisor

div.p: The Oyster Bay East Norwich Central School District welcomes Mr. Jack Bixhorn as K-12 Supervisor of Mathematics. Mr. Bixhorn comes to the District from the Deer Park School District where he served as Associate Principal of Robert Frost Middle School. Prior to this post, he served five years in the East Rockaway Union Free School District, most recently as an Elementary Math Specialist.

a.title: Go to comments for OBEN Welcomes New K-12 Math Supervisor

img.alt: AD is Named a L.I. Administrator of the Year

a.span: AD is Named a L.I. Administrator of the Year

div.p: Mr. Kevin Trentowski, Director of Health, Physical Education, & Athletics, was named a Long Island 2020 Administrator of the Year by the Council of Administrators and Supervisors. The award recognizes his achievements and contributions as an effective educational leader.

a.title: Go to comments for AD is Named a L.I. Administrator of the Year

div.p: As a way to foster unity while apart, OBHS Principal Ms. Sharon Lasher connected with juniors and seniors by hosting a virtual brunch for each class. In addition to the social aspects of connecting, students had an opportunity to engage in some meaningful conversation and have their questions and concerns addressed.

a.title: Go to comments for OBHS Connects with Virtual Brunch

img.alt: athletes of the month for february and march

div.p: Oyster Bay High School is proud to recognize its “Athletes of the Month” for February-March. This school tradition showcases student athletes who exhibit qualities that make them exemplary role models for their teammates. Coaches selected the following students:

a.title: Go to comments for Congratulations, Athletes of the Month
